item.title: Capitol riot: Policeman tells 6 January hearing he feared he would die
item.description: Officers on duty when Trump supporters stormed the US Capitol give tearful testimony at an inquiry.

item.title: Star gymnast Biles withdraws from all-around final
item.description: American gymnast and four-time Olympic gold medallist Simone Biles withdraws from the individual all-around final Tokyo Olympics.

item.title: Canadian police reveal decade-long Manitoba residential school inquiry
item.description: Police are investigating abuse claims at a former school that sought to assimilate indigenous children.

item.title: Lebanonâ€™s descent into darkness
item.description: The country's economic crisis has forced some families to move into refugee camps to survive.

item.title: Joey Jordison: Slipknot founding drummer dies aged 46
item.description: Jordison was a member of the mask-wearing heavy metal band and also performed with the likes of Metallica.

item.title: Barabanki accident: Eighteen die after truck crashes into bus in India
item.description: The victims were migrant workers who were going home to meet their families.

item.title: Atlanta spa shootings: Georgia man pleads guilty
item.description: Robert Aaron Long, charged with killing eight people in March, says he murdered four of the victims.

item.title: Ivory Coast president and rival in first meeting since civil war
item.description: President Alassane Ouattara and Laurent Gbagbo shook hands at the presidential palace on Tuesday.

item.title: Covid: Sydney extends lockdown as other Australian cities reopen
item.description: Infections in Australia's largest city remain stubbornly high, despite five weeks of restrictions.

item.title: Wu-Tang Clan album bought by Martin Shkreli sold by US government
item.description: The album was handed over as part of a $7.4m deal with a notorious former drug firm executive.

item.title: Gilgamesh tablet: US authorities take ownership of artefact
item.description: The Gilgamesh Dream Tablet was imported illegally into the US before being bought by Hobby Lobby.

item.title: Greece: Forest fire rips through area near Athens
item.description: About 300 firefighters, water-dropping planes and helicopters helped bring the blaze under control.

item.title: Dad builds robotic exoskeleton to help son walk
item.description: The French robotics engineer says he was inspired to build the suit after his son asked him to.

item.title: Indians turn to crowdfunding to pay Covid bills
item.description: More and more Indians are asking strangers to help them pay off crushing medical debt.

item.title: Key moments from first hearing of Capitol riot inquiry
item.description: Police officers gave emotional testimony about their struggles during the riot to US lawmakers.

item.title: Kris Wu: Why a superstar sparked China's sexual consent debate
item.description: A growing rape allegation controversy centering on Kris Wu has renewed discussion on sexual consent.

item.title: Roma student: 'My only goal is to finish school'
item.description: How one school in Croatia is working to improve education opportunities for Roma children like Kristina.

item.title: Zimbabwean with football dreams to be kicked out of UK
item.description: Christopher Arundell grew up in the UK but after doing time in jail is being deported to Zimbabwe.

item.title: The black immigrant who challenged US segregation - nearly 190 years ago
item.description: A black Brazilian immigrant was the first person in US history to challenge segregation in a courtroom

item.title: Mapping the advance of the Taliban in Afghanistan
item.description: Maps of Afghanistan show who controls districts in fighting between the government and Taliban forces.

item.title: The Indian girl killed for wearing jeans
item.description: Neha Paswan was allegedly beaten to death by relatives who disagreed with her choice of clothes.

item.title: Kenyans sue the British army over fire at wildlife sanctuary
item.description: Some 1,000 people are going to court after a fire destroyed 12,000 acres of land at a wildlife sanctuary.

item.title: Archibald Prize: 100 years of Australia's top portrait honour
item.description: Over 100 years, the Archibald Prize has become better at reflecting Australian diversity.

item.title: How US military pullback in Iraq could benefit Iran
item.description: The withdrawal of remaining US combat troops could help Iran achieve its ambitions.

item.title: Covid passports: How do they work around the world?
item.description: How are countries enforcing vaccine passports and what can people use them for?

item.title: Petrol bombs thrown at Cuban embassy in Paris
item.description: Cuba's foreign ministry has released surveillance footage of the attack at its embassy in France.

item.title: Capitol Hill police officer in tears during testimony
item.description: Officer Gonell gave an emotional statement during the first day of the US Capitol riot inquiry.

item.title: Brazil: Why are so many pregnant women dying from Covid?
item.description: One in five women that died from coronavirus in Brazil did not have access to an intensive care unit.

item.title: Is there a future for Africa's lions?
item.description: As lion populations decline across much of Africa, could community-led conservation help reverse this trend?

item.title: Tunisia: Key moments as political turmoil unfolds
item.description: Tunisia's president sacks the PM and the speaker is barred entry to parliament following violent protests.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Take a tour of the incredible venues
item.description: They range from an arena built by a father and son, to a legendary home of Japanese martial arts.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: German gymnasts' full-body suits inspire other athletes
item.description: British-Jamaican gymnast Danusia Francis believes athletes should have a choice over their outfits.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics medals table
item.description: Medals table for the 2020 Olympics in Tokyo.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Great Britain win emphatic gold in 4x200m freestyle relay
item.description: Great Britain's men secure another gold in the Olympic pool with a dominant victory in the 4x200m freestyle relay in Tokyo.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Flora Duffy claims historic first gold for Bermuda
item.description: With a population of just 63,000, Bermuda became the least populous nation or territory to win an Olympic gold medal at a summer Games when Flora Duffy won the triathlon in Tokyo.

item.title: Wright wins first ever Olympic surfing medal
item.description: Australian surfer Owen Wright marks his comeback from a traumatic brain injury by winning the first ever Olympic medal in surfing.
